alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 2:02AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Periods of Rainfall and Cooler Temps Continue through Wednesday... Moderate rain showers will continue across parts of the Interior through Wednesday. Periods of rain will result in an area of 0.5 to 1.0 inch of additional accumulations in the Fortymile Uplands and lower elevations of the Alaska Range, with lesser totals of up to a half inch in the Fairbanks area, White Mountains, and Minto Flats. High temperatures Tuesday will remain in the 50s with 40s in the Alaska Range. This rain will likely cause a rapid rise in river and stream levels across the Southeast Interior and Alaska Range. This includes the Chena, Chatanika, Goodpaster, Salcha River, and the Fortymile River. People along rivers and streams should prepare for elevated water levels through this week. River access points and gravel bars will likely be covered with water along with increased debris in rivers.

area.areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
